subject: Leadership
title: Strategic Communication
description: A quick, practical guide to Strategic Communication.

hook.text: A brilliant strategy sits in a 50-page document nobody reads. Six months later, teams are working on conflicting goals.

buildup.text: Strategy not communicated clearly is strategy that doesn't exist. People can't execute what they don't understand.

discovery.text: The best strategic communicators use simple frameworks: one page, three priorities, and a story that makes it memorable.

twist.text: Leaders think they've communicated strategy after one presentation. Research says it takes seven repetitions to stick.

climax.text: Share strategy through every channel: all-hands, one-on-ones, Slack, posters. Repetition isn't redundancyâ€”it's clarity.

punchline.text: If your team can't repeat the strategy, you haven't communicated it.

quiz.question: How many times must a strategy be communicated to stick?
options: About seven repetitions through multiple channels
It only needs to be in a document
